param.name: enabled
param.label: Enable {PSP} E-Payments
param.description: Whether you want to offer payments through {PSP}.
param.option: Enable single and auto-recurring payments at user's choice

param.name: normal_gateway
param.label: {PSP} server
param.description: Select the payments gateway to use.

param.name: gateway_psp_url
param.label: Server submission URL
param.description: This should be the {PSP}-compatible-server equivalent of {PSPPRODURL}

fieldset.name: fieldset_for_gateway
fieldset.label: PayPal Payflow credentials
fieldset.description: You can get your Paypal Payflow Vendor, Payflow User, and Payflow Password from your PayPal account in My account - Profile - My selling tools - API access - Request API credentials - Set up Payflow Pro API access. Make sure to use https (SSL) to access this administration area and to restrict its access to a 'Need to know' basis, as these Paypal account credentials must stay confidential.

param.name: paypal_payflow_vendor
param.label: PayPal account Payflow Vendor
param.description: Get this Payflow information from your PayPal account in My account - Profile - My selling tools - API access - Request API credentials - Set up Payflow Pro API access

param.name: paypal_payflow_user
param.label: PayPal account Payflow User
param.description: Get this Payflow information from your PayPal account in My account - Profile - My selling tools - API access - Request API credentials - Set up Payflow Pro API access

param.name: paypal_payflow_password
param.label: PayPal account Payflow Password
param.description: Get this Payflow information from your PayPal account in My account - Profile - My selling tools - API access - Request API credentials - Set up Payflow Pro API access

param.name: id
param.label: URL to set into {PSP} admin area in Hosted Checkout Pages - Set Up - "Enter Return URL"
param.default: First fill-in parameters above, then "Apply" this new gateway settings: Then this URL %s will be computed and displayed.
param.description: This is the "Return URL" to paste into {PSP} admin area

param.name: id
param.label: URL to set into {PSP} admin area in Hosted Checkout Pages - Set Up - "Enter Cancel URL"
param.default: First fill-in parameters above, then "Apply" this new gateway settings: Then this URL %s will be computed and displayed.
param.description: This is the "Cancel URL" to paste into {PSP} admin area

param.name: id
param.label: URL to set into {PSP} admin area in Hosted Checkout Pages - Set Up - "Enter Silent Post URL"
param.default: First fill-in parameters above, then "Apply" this new gateway settings: Then this URL %s will be computed and displayed.
param.description: This is the "Silent Post URL" to paste into {PSP} admin area

param.name: accept_payment_condition
param.label: Accept payment once
param.description: This option allows to set when a payment is deemed as completed by CBSubs. Credit-card authorization is usually immediate, except if acquirer is offline. In some cases you want to defer capture.
param.option: Even if payment is pending authorization, authorized or captured
Payment is authorized and captured (means completed)

fieldset.name: fieldset_for_antifraud
fieldset.label: Anti-Fraud-helping hidden fields
fieldset.description: If the invoicing address corresponds to credit card invoicing address, sending these in hidden fields to {PSP} might help for anti-fraud:

param.name: notifications_host
param.label: Notification host (leave blank)
param.description: Leave blank for most configurations. This setting is only in case you are running on a cluster and the payment gateway notifications (IPN, PDT) need to go at a different domain name than the website domain. In that case enter e.g. 'http://yourdomain.com'.

param.name: template_layout
param.label: Template Layout
param.description: Payment page hosted layout. This overrides the layout selected in Paypal manager.

param.name: psp_human_name
param.label: Name of payment provider to show to your customers
param.description: This is the name of the payment provider to show to your customers in title of payment button and in feedbacks

param.name: image
param.label: Payment Button
param.description: The payment button (visible only if an Intro Text is present or more than one payment processor enabled).

param.name: custom_image
param.label: Custom Payment Button Text or Image
param.description: Either text of button or URL of a custom payment image (.gif, .jpg or .bmp), overwites selection above.

param.name: button_title_text
param.label: Payment Button hover (title) text
param.description: Must be text, %s is replaced with the name of the payment method chosen

param.name: subscribe_image
param.label: Subscription Button
param.description: The payments subscriptions button (visible only if an Intro Text is present or more than one payment processor enabled AND recurring paypal payments are enabled.

param.name: subscribe_custom_image
param.label: Custom Subscription Button Text or Image
param.description: Either text of button or URL of a custom subscription image (.gif, .jpg or .bmp), overwites selection above.

param.name: subscribe_button_title_text
param.label: Subscription Button hover (title) text
param.description: Must be text, %s is replaced with the name of the payment method chosen
